page.title: 18WOKINGHAM - FARMING
page.content: The land in the study area is gently undulating and the height ranges from 46_76m. The main soil type of the area is London clay. There are 13 farms in the area mainly concentrating on arable crops such as wheat and barley.Some of the land is also used for hay or as ley pasture which is sometimes grazed by horses. However there are one or two farms specialising in poultry _ mainly factory farming, and dairying _ with a small amount of farm gate sales _ free range eggs, for example. Other crops grown in smaller quantities are peas and potatoes. The average field size is 11 hectares. Some of the farms have been fragmented by motorways and land on the rural_urban fringe is being lost to residential expansion.
